meanings.definition: a person who adjusts their opinions, principles, etc., to suit the times
meanings.sent1: The timeserver always changes their beliefs to fit in with the current trends.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known as a timeserver, adapting his views to match popular opinion.
meanings.sent3: The timeserver at the office meeting suddenly became a fan of the new coffee machine.
meanings.sent4: She was like a chameleon, a timeserver blending into any social circle effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The timeserver was like a leaf in the wind, swaying with every passing breeze.

meanings.definition: a person who is excessively deferential or submissive to those in authority
meanings.sent1: The timeserver always agrees with the boss, never questioning their decisions.
meanings.sent2: Being a timeserver, he never spoke up against the supervisor's unfair demands.
meanings.sent3: The timeserver nodded vigorously at everything the manager said, even if it was absurd.
meanings.sent4: She was a timeserver, bowing down to authority without a hint of resistance.
meanings.sent5: The timeserver was like a loyal dog, always seeking approval from the higher-ups.

meanings.definition: a person who is dishonest or untrustworthy in order to gain favor or advantage
meanings.sent1: The timeserver manipulated his colleagues for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a timeserver, willing to deceive others to climb the corporate ladder.
meanings.sent3: The timeserver cunningly twisted the truth to win the favor of the manager.
meanings.sent4: He was a timeserver, using deceit to secure promotions at the expense of others.
meanings.sent5: The timeserver was like a sly fox, always scheming for personal benefit.
